Starting Position: Begin on your hands and knees in a tabletop position. Align your wrists directly under your shoulders and your knees directly under your hips. Spread your fingers wide apart and press firmly into the mat with your palms.
Alignment: As you exhale, round your spine towards the ceiling, like a cat stretching its back. Tuck your chin towards your chest and draw your navel towards your spine to engage your core muscles.

Cat Stretch: Arch your back upwards towards the ceiling, allowing your head to relax between your arms. Feel the stretch along your entire spine, from your tailbone to the base of your neck.
Shoulder and Arm Position: Keep your arms straight and perpendicular to the floor. Press firmly into the mat with your palms to create stability in your upper body. Your shoulders should be relaxed away from your ears.

Hip and Knee Alignment: Ensure that your knees remain directly under your hips throughout the pose. Keep your shins and tops of your feet grounded on the mat.
Breathing: Coordinate your breath with movement. Inhale as you come into a neutral tabletop position, and exhale as you round your spine into Cat Pose. Focus on deep, smooth breaths to help release tension.

Core Engagement: Engage your abdominal muscles to support your lower back and protect your spine. Draw your belly button towards your spine to create a strong and stable core.
Neck Alignment: Avoid compressing the back of your neck. Keep your neck in line with your spine and gaze towards your thighs or navel.\n\n
